messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Need to analyze the trend of the U.S. federal government spending and deficit before and after the pandemic. Please provide me with the following data through fiscal years 2015-2024: the federal Budget (trillion), the federal spending (trillion), the federal deficit (trillion), the national debt (trillion), and the net interest cost on the gross federal debt (trillion).

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following column names in order: 
Fiscal Year, Federal Budget, Federal Spending, Federal Deficit, National Debt, Net Interest Cost.
 
Under the Fiscal Year, state the statistics like FY2015, FY2016.

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```?
<search>U.S. federal government spending and deficit trend 2015-2024</search>

Search query: U.S. federal government spending and deficit trend 2015-2024
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data In FY 2025 total government spending was $7.01 trillion and total revenue was $5.23 trillion, resulting in a deficit of $1.78 trillion, a decrease of $41 ...

[Doc 2](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/federal-spending/):
Federal Spending | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data Compared to the federal spending of $1.25 trillion for the same period last year (Oct 2024 - Nov 2024) our federal spending has decreased by $55 billion.

[Doc 3](https://bipartisanpolicy.org/report/deficit-tracker/):
Deficit Tracker - Bipartisan Policy Center The federal government's deficit in fiscal year 2025 was $1.8 trillionâ€”4% lower than last year's after adjusting for timing effects. Revenues increased by 6%, ...
<search>U.S. federal government spending and deficit trend 2015-2024 federal budget</search>

Search query: U.S. federal government spending and deficit trend 2015-2024 federal budget
Result: [Doc 1](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data In FY 2025, the federal government spent $7.01 trillion and collected $5.23 trillion in revenue, resulting in a deficit.

[Doc 2](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/61181):
The Federal Budget in Fiscal Year 2024: An Infographic The federal deficit in 2024 was $1.8 trillion, equal to 6.4 percent of gross domestic product.

[Doc 3](https://taxfoundation.org/blog/federal-budget-deficit-tcja-revenue-spending/):
Federal Budget Deficit: US Spending & Tax Collections Post-TCJA Overall, CBO estimates spending grew 10 percent in FY24 to $6.8 trillion. At about 23.4 percent of GDP, federal spending in FY24 was above the ...

Search query: FY2025 federal budget deficit national debt
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.cbo.gov/publication/61307):
Monthly Budget Review: Summary for Fiscal Year 2025 The federal deficit in 2025 was equal to 5.9 percent of the nation's gross domestic product (GDP), a decrease from 6.3 percent of GDP in 2024.

[Doc 2](https://fiscaldata.treasury.gov/americas-finance-guide/national-deficit/):
National Deficit | U.S. Treasury Fiscal Data In FY 2025 total government spending was $7.01 trillion and total revenue was $5.23 trillion, resulting in a deficit of $1.78 trillion, a decrease of $41 ...

[Doc 3](https://www.crfb.org/blogs/12-month-deficit-totals-17-trillion-debt-approaches-100-gdp):
12-Month Deficit Totals $1.7 Trillion, Debt Approaches 100% of GDP CBO also estimated that deficits for FY 2025 totaled 5.9% of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and debt reached 99.8% of GDP. The deficit in October ...
